{"step_by_step_thinking": "Transmission Assessment Surveys (TAS) are recommended by the World Health Organization to determine when an evaluation unit has achieved elimination of transmission of the vector-borne macroparasitic disease Lymphatic Filariasis (LF). This means that TAS is used to determine when infections have been reduced below target thresholds. There is no mention of TAS being used for assessing primary immunization coverage or providing reliable estimates of birth rate, death rate, and infant mortality rate.", "answer_choice": "A"}
